channel.title: Posts on Website of David Issa Mattos
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Website of David Issa Mattos

item.title: Causal graphs in automotive experimentation
item.description: Today, we received the news that our (very short) paper on the use of Causal DAGs for designing experiments was accepted to be presented in EASE 2022.

item.title: Updates
item.description: I hope now that I have a bit more time, I can write more here. In the last few months, I concluded my Ph.

item.title: Plot Panels in R (from brms models)
item.description: This week I had to make a panel with results from 5 different brms models in R. The ggplot2 allows you to do facet_wraps to create a panel with multiple plots but it also requires that you have a well formated dataframe.

item.title: Paper accepted at IEEE Transactions on Evolutionary Computation!
item.description: I am happy to announce that our paper “Statistical Models for the Analysis of Optimization Algorithms with Benchmark Functions” by David Issa Mattos, Jan Bosch and Helena Holmström Olsson has been accepted for publication at the IEEE Transactions on Evolutionary Computation (DOI:10.

item.title: Structuring a Latex project for a paper
item.description: Over the last five years, I have written papers in different combinations of Word + Mendeley/Zotero, Latex/Overleaf, Google Docs + Zotero, Word Online + Mendeley.

item.title: On the Assessment of Benchmark Suites for Algorithm Comparison
item.description: Today, we submitted a new paper (On the Assessment of Benchmark Suites for Algorithm Comparison) to the IEEE Transactions on Evolutionary Computing (and of course to Arxiv).

item.title: bpcs - release v.1.2.0
item.description: We have a new release of the bpcs package on Github. This release introduces a few new features, removed dependencies and mostly moved from rstan to cmdstanr.

item.title: Writing R packages With Stan
item.description: Now, I have been developing the bpcs package for the last 4 months I thought of sharing a bit my experience with developing a R package with Stan.

item.title: SE Seminar 2021 - “Bayesian Bradley-Terry models: from primates to machine learning”
item.description: This Feb 5th, I will present some of my research around Bradley-Terry models in the SE Seminar at Chalmers. My goal is to show a the generality of the Bayesian BT model and that it can be used for both behavior research as well as software engineering.

item.title: Bayesian Paired-Comparison with the bpcs Package
item.description: Yesterday, we submitted the paper: Mattos, D. I. and Ramos, E. M. S. “Bayesian Paired-Comparison with the bpcs Package” arxiv:2101.11227

item.title: bpcs - release v.1.1
item.description: A new release of the bpcs package is available in Github. This release introduces new models and correct some bugs. This release will be submitted to CRAN (not there yet) and the on-going paper we are writing is based on this release.

item.title: The GYSS started this week
item.description: The Global Youth Scientists Summit (GYSS) conference started this week. The GYSS is a gathering of PhD students and post-docs of al over the world to discuss and hear from top scientists and leaders.

item.title: bpcs - release v.1.0.1
item.description: This is a minor release to streamline the usage of the bpcs package, correct a few bugs and add publication-ready functions for tables and figures

item.title: The bpcs package is now on CRAN
item.description: After some months of work the bpcs package is at version v1.0.0 and is available on CRAN (https://CRAN.R-project.org/package=bpcs). Now we can easily run Bayesian inference on Bradley-Terry models (including many extensions).

item.title: New website
item.description: As I am finishing now my PhD, I decided it was time to have a personal website with a section to create some small personal blog posts, update my cv etc.
